content.text: JavaScript code is inserted between <script> and </script> tags. You can place scripts in the <head>, in the <body>, or in an external file.
Placing scripts at the bottom of the <body> element improves the display speed, because script interpretation slows down the display.
Scripts can be placed in external files. External scripts are referenced with a src attribute: <script src="myScript.js"></script>

rows: HTML and JS are in separate files
One script used by many HTML pages
Browser caches the file for faster loads
